tls:text.tls:srcline: 時閻浮提天下富樂安隱，
tls:text.tls:line: At that time, the Jambu-dvīpā42 world was prosperous and peaceful;

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. jambu-dvīpa; pali jambu-dīpa; 閻浮 transliterates jambu which originally refers to a kind of tree (Eugenia jambolana) and 提 refers to dvīpa, 'continent'; in Buddhist cosmology this refers to the southern continent among the four continents surrounding Mt. Sumeru. Only this continent was thought of being in possession of a 'Diamond-seat' (jīngāng zuò 金剛座) which is the place where all Bodhisattvas gain enlightenment.
